content:
Yes, there are several ways to keep your puppy entertained when you're not able to be with them. Here are some suggestions:

1. Interactive Toys: Invest in some interactive toys that dispense treats or require your puppy to figure out a puzzle. These toys can keep your puppy engaged and mentally stimulated when they're home alone. 2. Chew Toys: Providing your puppy with a variety of chew toys can help them to satisfy their natural urge to chew and prevent destructive chewing behavior. 3. Kong Toys: Kong toys are a type of chew toy that are perfect for stuffing with treats or peanut butter. They can provide hours of entertainment for your puppy and help to keep them occupied while you're away. 4. Puppy Playpen: A puppy playpen can be a great way to create a safe and stimulating environment for your puppy when you're not home. It can provide them with space to play and explore, and help to prevent accidents or destructive behavior. 5. Dog Walker or Sitter: Consider hiring a dog walker or sitter to come and spend time with your puppy while you're away. This can provide your puppy with some much-needed socialization and exercise, and help to keep them happy and healthy. Remember to supervise your puppy whenever they are playing with toys, and make sure to remove any toys that are damaged or pose a hazard. With a little creativity and planning, you can help to keep your puppy entertained and happy when you can't be with them.
